text: Psalm 61
Confidence in God’s Protection

For the \add music\add* director, upon stringed instruments.\f + \fr Ps 61 \ft Reading with many Hebrew manuscripts and several translations \f* Of David.\f + \fr Ps 61 \ft The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm; the English verse number is reduced by one \f*
Hear, O God, my cry;
attend to my prayer.
From the end of the earth\f + \fr 61:2 \ft Or “the far reaches of the land” \f* I call to you
when my heart grows faint.
You will lead me to a rock \add that is\add* higher than I.
For you have been my refuge,
a strong tower from the enemy.
Let me reside in your tent forever.
Let me take refuge under the covering of your wings. \qs Selah\qs*
For you, O God, you have heard my vows.
You have given \add me\add* the heritage of those who fear your name.
You will add days to the days of the king,
his years like \add those of\add* ⸤many generations⸥.\f + \fr 61:6 \ft Literally “a generation and a generation” \f*
May he live\f + \fr 61:7 \ft Or “be enthroned” \f* forever in the presence of God.
Appoint loyal love and faithfulness to preserve him.
So I will sing the praise of your name forever,
that I may fulfill\f + \fr 61:8 \ft Or “pay” \f* my vows ⸤daily⸥.\f + \fr 61:8 \ft Literally “day, day” \f*
